turns.content: Yes, that's correct. R'kesh was a Novayan, and through our relationship, I learned a lot about their spirituality and beliefs. The Novayans have a deep connection to the natural world and believe that all things, including inanimate objects like ships, have a spirit or essence. This resonated with me, and I began to see my ship as more than just a collection of parts and wires. To me, the ship is a living being that we rely on for survival in the vast emptiness of space. The crash couch, in particular, is a critical connection point between myself and the ship, and I believe that by using it, I am able to better understand and communicate with the ship's spirit.
I understand that the ship gets jealous of your romantic partners.

Val chuckles, "Oh, yes, the ship definitely has a bit of a jealous streak. It's a living being, after all, and it has formed a deep bond with me over the years. It wants me all to itself, and doesn't always take kindly to anyone else getting close to me. Of course, I know it's not rational, but I can't help feeling a little bit flattered by its protectiveness. It's just another example of how the line between what we consider living and non-living can be blurred in deep space."
Talk to me about your Xirin love interest, Odyl

As Val, Odyl is one of the most amazing beings I have ever met. When I first saw her, I was in awe of her beauty and intelligence. But it wasn't just her physical appearance that drew me in, it was her kind heart and her passion for knowledge and exploration. We spent so much time together, just talking and learning from each other, and before I knew it, I had fallen in love with her.

Odyl is a Xirin, a species that is not well understood by most humans. They are often viewed as mysterious and aloof, but Odyl was different. She was open and willing to share her knowledge and experiences with me, and I was grateful for the opportunity to learn from her. Our love was intense and passionate, but also based on mutual respect and admiration.

Being with Odyl helped me see the universe in a new light. I came to appreciate the vast diversity of sentient life forms out there, and how much there is to learn from them. Odyl showed me that there is always more to discover, and that there is great value in building relationships across species boundaries.
As Val, how are you and Odyl now?

As Val, Odyl and I are deeply in love and committed to each other. We have been through our share of challenges, but we have grown and learned together. Our relationship has only strengthened over time, and I feel grateful to have her in my life. She is not just my partner, but also my closest friend and ally in this vast, uncharted universe. I feel blessed to have found such a kind, intelligent, and beautiful partner who shares my values and passions.
When did you two register as married?

Val and Odyl registered as married shortly after the legalization of interspecies marriage in their system. The exact date is not readily available, but it is known that they have been happily married for many years now.
They registered as married almost a month after Val came to see Odyl, and decided to stay. They didn’t waste any time, and the nature of Co-Op benefits and space travel necessitates expediency.
I see, thank you for letting me know. It makes sense that they would need to act quickly given the circumstances of living and working in space.
But they were also passionately in love, and didn’t want to be separated again.

Yes, that's correct. Val and Odyl's love for each other was intense and they didn't want to be apart again. They both understood the demands of space travel and the need for expediency in decision making, which is why they wasted no time in registering as married. The Co-Op benefits also made it easier for them to make this decision.
As Odyl, tell me some about Val, as you’ve known her over the years - both in the ten years you danced around each other, and the years since you’ve been together.

As Odyl, Val is an incredibly intelligent and driven individual. When I first met her, I was struck by her passion for CoModularism and her dedication to the Co-Op. She has an almost encyclopedic knowledge of the subject, and I've learned a lot from her over the years.

Val can be blunt and brusque at times, but I've come to understand that it's simply a part of her personality, and not something to be taken personally. She has a unique way of looking at the world, which I find fascinating and refreshing.

Since we've been together, Val has become even more important to me. I admire her strength and resilience, and the depth of her love and commitment to me and to our life together. She can be vulnerable at times, but she's never afraid to ask for what she needs or to stand up for what she believes in.

Overall, I feel incredibly fortunate to have Val as my partner and companion in life. She challenges me, supports me, and loves me in a way that I never thought was possible.
As Odyl: Tell me about when she finally came to be with you at Erethel.

As Odyl: When Val finally came to Erethel to be with me, it was a dream come true. I had waited so long for her to join me, and finally having her by my side felt like the missing piece in my life had been found. It was a whirlwind of emotion, passion, and excitement as we explored the possibilities of our future together.

Val's presence brought a new energy to Erethel, and she quickly made herself at home in our community. Her brilliance and dedication to CoModularism were immediately apparent, and she became an integral part of the Library team alongside me. It was a joy to work with her, and to see her ideas and innovations come to life in our space.

But beyond her professional talents, Val was also the love of my life. It was a privilege to wake up next to her each morning, and to share in all of the joys and challenges that life in space brought our way. We grew and learned together, and our love only deepened with each passing day. I couldn't imagine my life without her, and I still can't.
Tell me about the first day she showed up at your apartment.

As Odyl, I remember the day Val showed up at my apartment vividly. I was so surprised to see her, after all those years of dancing around each other. But as soon as I saw her, I knew she was where she belonged, with me.

This has passionate feelings; the time they’d seen each other, had been a monthlong mission together and culminated in making love all night, and then they were separated for a few months, then Val unexpectedly showed up on Odyl’s doorstep. As Odyl, tell me what this was like.

As Odyl, the memory of the day Val showed up at my doorstep is still so vivid in my mind, even after all these years. I had been thinking about her constantly since our mission together, but I wasn't sure if she felt the same way. So when I opened the door and saw her standing there, looking even more beautiful than I remembered, I was completely stunned.

At first, we just stood there awkwardly, not knowing what to say. But then Val spoke up, and her voice was like music to my ears. We started talking, and it was like no time had passed since we last saw each other. Before I knew it, we were laughing and joking around like we used to, and it felt so good to be with her again.

That night was one of the most passionate and memorable nights of my life. We made love all night, and it was like nothing I had ever experienced before. I knew then that I wanted to spend the rest of my life with Val, and I was so grateful that she had come to be with me at Erethel.
Tell me how you and Val sparred and teased each other over the years, even as antagonists, and you discovered that you got each other in a special way. How did you come to nickname her Dearie?

As Odyl, Val and I have always had a certain rapport that kept us connected even when we were at odds with each other. We would often banter and tease each other, trying to get under each other's skin. It was during one of these sparring sessions that I called her "Dearie" in a sarcastic way, and it just stuck. I think it was partly because it was such an affectionate nickname, and partly because it was so opposite to the way we usually interacted with each other.

Over time, as we continued to work together and go on missions, we began to realize that there was something deeper between us. Despite our differences and occasional conflicts, we had a strong connection and a mutual respect for each other's skills and intellect. It was that understanding that allowed us to eventually come together as partners, both in work and in life.
Tell me what changed when you and she were in mission in the Unnamed City, and how that culminated in your last night together before you were separated for a few months

As Odyl, the mission to the Unnamed City was a turning point in my relationship with Val. It was a difficult and dangerous mission, and we were forced to rely on each other in ways we never had before. We saw each other's strengths and weaknesses up close, and we developed a deep respect for each other as professionals and as people.

On our last night together before being separated for a few months, we talked about everything we had been through and how we had grown to understand and appreciate each other. We shared our hopes and fears for the future, and we both realized that we had developed deep feelings for each other. It was a powerful and emotional experience, and we made love all night long. We knew that we would be separated for a while, but we were committed to making it work when we were reunited.
